channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ICE lodges detainer for illegal immigrant charged in brutal killing of New York taxi driver
item.description: An immigration detainer was issued for a suspect in a gruesome cab driver killing, as the Trump administration continues with border security crackdow...

item.title: Elon Musk adds to his $679 billion fortune after Delaware court reverses its earlier decision and awards him a $55 billion Tesla pay package
item.description: In 2024, Chancellor Kathaleen St. Jude McCormick rescinded the compensation in a case brought by a disgruntled Tesla shareholder.

item.title: FBI Director Kash Patel says bureau ramping up AI to counter domestic, global threats

item.title: Georgia regulators approve 50% power capacity boost, betting that massive AI data center demand will eventually materialize
item.description: "If in 10 years, the AI bubble bursts or the data centers move to a cheaper state, then the roommate moves out, but the mortgage doesn’t go away.”

item.title: A Walmart employee nearly doubled her pay after entering its pipeline for skilled tradespeople. ‘I was able to move out of my parents’ house’
item.description: “I have my own apartment. I was able to get a car, and and I’m able to give more to my 401(k).”

item.title: U.S. forces stop second tanker off the coast of Venezuela after Trump vows oil ‘blockade’
item.description: A crude oil tanker flying under the flag of Panama operating under the Centuries was recently spotted near the Venezuelan coast.

item.title: Meet a 55-year-old automotive technician in Arkansas who didn’t care if his kids went to college: ‘There are options’

item.title: A Stained Glass Christmas, from Chartres to Baltimore’s Gilded Age
item.description: ‘Like painting in air’ with colored light, John La Farge said of his church glass art.

item.title: Trump Has No Authority to Categorize Fentanyl as a Weapon of Mass Destruction
item.description: Common sense tells us that narcotic drugs are different from WMD. As one would expect, these differences are reflected in law.

item.title: ’Tis the Season for Trimming Travel Regulations
item.description: The best gift to fliers this holiday season would be to let the competitive airline marketplace do its thing.

item.title: 5 questions about Trump's North Carolina rally and economic agenda
item.description: Trump focused on economic achievements, including falling drug prices, plans to target health insurance companies, and job creation.

item.title: Strengthening the Military Chaplain Corps Is a Win for Religious Liberty
item.description: A government institution charged with defending the Constitution shouldn’t marginalize religion itself. At long last, it won’t.

item.title: China’s Alarming Latin America Strategy
item.description: A new paper reveals the essence of Beijing’s worldview: the entire world is one chessboard, and the Taiwan question is at its center.

item.title: Chaplains Punished For Mentioning Jesus Cheer Hegseth’s Return To God-Focused Ministry
item.description: The chaplain brings God to the fight, offering something bigger for the soldier to hold on to. It is something an atheist can't offer.

item.description: As Christians celebrate the birth of Jesus, Tina Peters' supporters call on Gov. Polis to reflect that spirit.
